results.title: Sunpower
results.creator_credit: Dan Bessie, Barr Films and Shire Films
results.brief_description: An animated film tracing the history of our knowledge about the sun, also showing the ways in which the earth is dependent on the sun. The use of solar energy, emphasizing the power potential of the sun is also described.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dan Bessie, Barr Films and Shire Films

results.title: Animals that build
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This film focuses on animals as engineers, constructing elaborate dwellings and protection devices. From tiny microscopic creatures like coral, insects like spiders and caterpillars through to birds and mammals like beavers and man, the program provides a useful insight into the natural world. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Learning to read maps. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: David Jay, Acorn Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A mimed fantasy about a lost clown who helps children understand the usefulness of maps. Teaches students that maps are graphic representations of real places, how to recognize symbols representing physical features on maps, how to find directions without using a compass and how to calculate distances to a destination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Jay, Acorn Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: From here to there: map reading
results.brief_description: Uses a fantasy journey by two American schoolboys to show the importance of using maps as a survival skill. Though not teaching map reading skills as such, this film should prove valuable as a basic introduction to the study of maps. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: The Siege of Pinchgut
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Made in Australia by Ealing Studios, this film is concerned with the escape from prison of a man who claims he has been unjustly incarcerated. He escapes and lands on Pinchgut Island in Sydney Harbour, occupies a disused arsenal and defies a police seige by taking the caretaker and his family hostage. Stars Aldo Ray and Heather Sears with Richard Vernon, Grant Taylor and Kenneth Warren. Screenplay by Harry Watt and Jon Cleary.

results.title: Hitler: revenge to ruin
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: This film documents those events during World War II that gradually led to Hitler’s fall from power and eventual suicide inthe face of defeat. Shows Hitler at the apex of his power in 1940. With the defeat of France, Hitler was not content to stop his drive for control of Europe. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: So many voices: a look at abortion in America
results.creator_credit: Victoria Hamburg, DHS Films and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the issue of abortion in America and the cases for and against abortion in relation to such areas as rape, incest, child abuse, mother’s health and genetic abnormalities. Note that the film is sponsored by the Naitonal Abortion Rights League Foundation Education Project in America and is pro-abortion in its approach. It is therefore strongly recommended that teachers preview the film before screening it to students. Narrated by Ed Asner and Tammy Grimes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Yohannes the silversmith (Ethiopia)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gilbert, Paul Quigley and Sunrise Film's Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
This film highlights the customs and traditions of villagers in Ethiopia, as well as evidence of cultural change. It focuses on a twelve-year-old boy who decides to learn the craft of silver smithing to earn an income to help pay for his tertiary education.

results.title: Lena the glassblower: Sweden
results.creator_credit: Peter Rowe, Fred Harris, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The story of Lena, a 17-year-old girl who decides to become a glassblower against the wishes of her parents, who want her to take up tertiary education. As well as dealing positively with this conflict, the film shows many aspects of the craft of glassblowing - in particular, that carried out at the Orrefors establishment in Sweden. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
